short_summary: Construction of Trisonic Wind Tunnel Cooling Tower Replacement
description: The National Research Council Canada (NRC) requires a General Contractor to carry out construction work to supply and install a new cooling tower system at NRC’s Trisonic Wind Tunnel Facility, located at Uplands Campus, Bldg. U-66, 655 Levy Private, in Ottawa, Ontario. The scope of work is to construct a new cooling tower outside of the north side of Building U66, located at 655 Levy Private, Ottawa, Ontario. The General Contractor will be required to procure equipment and material for the cooling tower on behalf of NRC and hire sub-contractors to construct and install the new equipment specified in the Issued for Tender design package.  Provide General Contractor construction services as outlined in the construction documents, including but not limited to: Erecting and maintaining a secure construction area; Procurement of equipment for the cooling system; Constructing the cooling tower system; Installing electrical upgrades and connections; Installing new cooling piping and connecting to the existing system; Commissioning of the cooling tower systems; Proving training to facility staff; Removing the existing interim cooling system and foundation; Project reporting; Preparing as-built drawings; Participating in bi-weekly construction meetings.

## Trisonic Wind Tunnel Cooling Tower Replacement Project

### Project Overview
The National Research Council of Canada (NRC) is seeking a general contractor to replace the cooling tower at its Trisonic Wind Tunnel Facility located in Ottawa, Ontario. The scope of work includes constructing a new cooling tower, procuring equipment and materials, and hiring sub-contractors to install the specified equipment.

### Key Requirements

* Construct a new cooling tower outside the north side of Building U66 at 655 Levy Private, Ottawa, Ontario
* Procure equipment and materials for the cooling tower on behalf of NRC
* Hire sub-contractors to construct and install equipment specified in the ISSUED FOR TENDER design package
* Provide general contracting services, including securing the construction area, constructing the cooling tower system, installing electrical upgrades and connections, and commissioning the cooling tower systems

### Project Timeline
The contractor must complete the work within 42 weeks, with notable constraints:
* Client testing in the wind tunnel facility from September 1, 2024 to March 31, 2025
* Shutdowns to the existing cooling system will not be permitted during working hours
* Short shutdowns during non-working hours may be permitted with prior approval

### Evaluation and Selection
The contractor selection methodology is based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price. The bidder must achieve a pass mark of 24 out of 40 (60%) to obtain an overall score. The successful bidder will be the one who accumulates the highest combined score of the technical weighted score and tendered amount score.

### Mandatory Security Requirement
The procurement contains a mandatory security requirement. Before award of a contract, the bidder must hold a valid Security Clearance as indicated in section SC01 of the Supplementary Conditions.

### Tender Documents
Firms intending to submit tenders on this project should obtain tender documents through Canadabuys. Drawings and specifications are now published and available free of charge in PDF format only.

### Important Dates
* Publication date: June 7, 2024
* Closing date: July 9, 2024 at 14:00:00
* Amendment date: July 9, 2024

### Contact Information
For more information, please contact Cindy Marshall at cindy.marshall@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca or (647) 548-8469. Further information is available on the Canadabuys website.

### Attachment
The tender notice includes attachments containing relevant project information, specifications, and drawings.
